circumstances: The crew departed Lomé Airport in the morning on a patrol flight over the gulf of Guinea. En route, both engines' temperature increased and shortly later, they failed quite simultaneously. The crew reduced his altitude and attempted to ditch the aircraft that crashed into the Atlantic Ocean (international waters) about 320 km west of Annobón Island. A pilot was rescued while the second occupant died. The aircraft sank and was lost.
probable_cause:
Powerplant failure for undetermined reasons. The following findings were reported:
- Excessive temperature, 
- Pilot noted zero oil pressure,
- High temperature.
